block.p: Patricia Ann Haggerty, a daughter of Ellen Haggerty and James Haggerty of Middletown, N.J., was married yesterday to Brian Christopher Dodwell, a son of Bonnie Dodwell of Cary, N.C., and David Dodwell of Southampton, Bermuda. The Rev. Alexei Michalenko, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at the Dahlgren Chapel at Georgetown University.

Mrs. Dodwell, 25, teaches third grade at Samuel W. Tucker Elementary School in Alexandria, Va. She graduated from Pennsylvania State University and is studying for a master's degree in education at George Mason University.

Patricia Ann Haggerty, a daughter of Ellen Haggerty and James Haggerty of Middletown, N.J., was married yesterday to Brian Christopher Dodwell, a son of Bonnie Dodwell of Cary, N.C., and David Dodwell of Southampton, Bermuda. The Rev. Alexei Michalenko, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at the Dahlgren Chapel at Georgetown University.

Patricia Ann Haggerty, a daughter of Ellen Haggerty and James Haggerty of Middletown, N.J., was married yesterday to Brian Christopher Dodwell, a son of Bonnie Dodwell of Cary, N.C., and David Dodwell of Southampton, Bermuda. The Rev. Alexei Michalenko, a Roman Catholic priest, performed the ceremony at the Dahlgren Chapel at Georgetown University.

Mrs. Dodwell, 25, teaches third grade at Samuel W. Tucker Elementary School in Alexandria, Va. She graduated from Pennsylvania State University and is studying for a master's degree in education at George Mason University.
Her father is a financial analyst for Con Ed in New York. Her mother is the secretary to the business administrator of the public schools of Little Silver, N.J.

Mr. Dodwell, 29, is a consultant on homeland security at DFI International, a Washington firm that does research, analysis and consulting for government departments and agencies. He graduated from Wake Forest and received a master's degree in national security studies from Georgetown.

His mother teaches humanities and language arts at the Cary Academy, a private school. His father owns the Nisbet Plantation Beach Club on the island of Nevis in the West Indies, and is an owner of the Reefs, a hotel in Southampton. He is also a member of the lower house of Bermuda's parliament.
The bridegroom is a stepson of Margarita Dodwell.
